paragraphs.content: Chapter 31
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 31

paragraphs.content: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

paragraphs.content: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

paragraphs.content: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

paragraphs.content: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

paragraphs.content: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

paragraphs.content: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

paragraphs.content: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

paragraphs.content: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

paragraphs.content: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

paragraphs.content: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

paragraphs.content: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

paragraphs.content: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

paragraphs.content: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

paragraphs.content: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

paragraphs.content: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

paragraphs.content: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

paragraphs.content: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

paragraphs.content: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

paragraphs.content: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

paragraphs.content: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

paragraphs.content: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

paragraphs.content: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

paragraphs.content: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

paragraphs.content: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

paragraphs.content: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

paragraphs.content: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

paragraphs.content: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

paragraphs.content: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

paragraphs.content: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the Lord, she shall be praised.

paragraphs.content: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
